ï»¿Administration Agreement between t he Agence FranVaise de Diveloppement and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Developmi nt and the International Development Association concerning the Africa Transport Policy Program - Third Development Plan Multi-Donor Trust Fund (No. TFO 72340) 1. The International Bank for F econstruction and Development and the International Development Association (collectively, the "Bank') acknowledge that the Agence Franqaise de Diveloppement (the "Donor", and together with the Bank the "Parties" and each a "Party") agrees to provide the 3um of one million Euros (EUR 1,000,000) (the "Contribution") for the Africa Transport Policy Program - Third Development Plan Multi-Donor Trust Fund (No. TF072340) (the "Trust Fund") in accordance with the terms of this Administration Agreement. C ther donors are also expected to contribute to the Trust Fund on the terms and conditions specified in the A nnexes to this Administration Agreement. 2. The Contribution shall be us .d to finance the activities set forth in the "Africa Transport Policy Program - Third Development Plan Nulti-Donor Trust Fund Description" attached hereto as Annex 1, and shall be administered by the Bank on t ehalf of the Donor in accordance with the terms of this Administration Agreement, including the "Standard rovisions" attached hereto as Annex 2 and "Governance" attached hereto as Annex 3. 3. The Donor shall deposit the C )ntribution promptly following countersignature in the full amount and currency ("Contribution Currency") s )ecified in Section I above into such bank account designated by the Bank upon submission of a payment rt quest by the Bank (such deposit being an "Installment"). 4. When making any deposit, :he Donor shall instruct its bank to include in its deposit details information (remittance advice) field of its SWIFT deposit message, information indicating: the amount deposited, that the deposit is made by :he Donor for TF072340 (the Africa Transport Policy Program - Third Development Plan Multi-Donor Trus Fund), and the date of the deposit (the "Deposit Instructions"). In addition, the Donor shall provide a c( py of the Deposit Instructions to the Bank's Accounting Trust Funds Division by e-mail sent to tfremitadvice@worldbank.org or by fax sent to +1 (202) 614-1315. 5. Except with respect to the Doposit Instructions, any notice, request or other communication to be given or made under this Administration Agreement shall be in writing and delivered by mail, fax or e-mail to the respective Party's address speci fied below or at such other address as such Party notifies in writing to the other Party from time to time: For the Bank (the "Bank Cont ict"): Mrs. Zeina Samara Co-financing Officer Transport and ICT Gi 9bal Practice - GTIDR The World Bank 1818 H street NW, Wtshington DC, 20043 Tel: 202 458 4147 E-mail: zsamara@wo -ldbank.org For the Donor (the "Donor Cc ntact"): Arnaud Desmarchelie - Project Manager AFD 1
ï»¿5 rue Roland Barthes 75598 Paris Cedex 12 Tel: +33 (0)1 53 44 3. 14 Fax: +33 (0)1 53 44 37 48 E-mail: desmarchelier 2@afd.fr 6. In the event any amounts are o be returned to the Donor under this Administration Agreement, the Bank shall transfer such amounts to he Donor's applicable donor balance account with the Bank, unless otherwise agreed with the Bank. 7. All annexes hereto constitute in integral part of this Administration Agreement, whose terms taken together shall constitute the entire ag eement and understanding between the Donor and the Bank. Unless otherwise specified in an annex here o, this Administration Agreement may be amended only by written amendment between the Bank and th: Donor; provided, however, that any annexes to this Administration Agreement may be amended only by written amendment of all donors contributing to the Trust FLnd. 8. Each of the Parties represents by confirming its agreement below, that it is authorized to enter into this Administration Agreement and z ct in accordance with these terms and conditions. The Parties are requested to sign and date this Admi iistration Agreement, and upon possession by the Bank of this fully signed Administration Agreement, this Administration Agreement shall become effective as of the date of the last signature. INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT INTERNATIONAL DEVEL ME NT ASSOCIATION By:_ Pierre Guislain Senior Director - Yansport & ICT Global Practice Date: 0 1 1 8 2 0 15 i lS AGENCE FRAN(AISE DE DEVELOPPEMENT By: Jean-Marc Gravellini i Jean- c G VELLINI Operations Director Direc ur 6cutif Date: ___ t 1____ 2
ï»¿ANNEX I Africa Transport Policy Program - Third Development Plan Multi-Donor Trust Fund Description This Annex shall be applicable to an 1 form an integral part of all administration agreements for the Trust Fund (collectively, the "Administratio i Agreements" and each an "Administration Agreement") between the Bank and any entities that provide any funds to the Trust Fund (collectively, the "Donors"). 1. Ob6ectives The objectives of the Trust Fund is io cause a number of African countries develop sound strategies and policies for an efficient, safe, and slistainable transport in the program three pillar areas of integration, connectivity and cohesion, urban mob lity and accessibility and road safety. 2. Activities Under the Third Development Plan Framework 2015-2018, the SSATP Work Program Activities are grouped under three pillars. Pillar 1: Integration, Connectivity and Cohesion Carrying out a program of activiti -s aimed at supporting African countries and regional economic communities (RECs) adopt and imp ement policies and strategies to facilitate trade and connectivity at country and regional levels, and enabl, efficient logistic services. Pillar 2: Urban Transport and Mobilit) Carrying out a program of activities a med at supporting African countries develop and implement coherent urban transport policies, and supp(rting the establishment of appropriate institutions for managing, regulating and delivering urban translort services. Such support to include designing capacity development programs for urban transport institutio ris and urban transport leadership and providing support to cities to put in place the appropriate framework foi investments in urban transport. Pillar 3: Road Safety Carrying out a program of activities ai ned at improving road safety management, and introducing measures to strengthen the safety of vulnerable ioad users. Such activities to include: (i) a revie N of country policies and strategies to ensure their effectiveness and alignment with global and African frameworks for road safety- with focus on improved data management, high impact interventions and increasc d urban road safety and the provision of guidance at both regional and country levels as necessary; (ii) the pr :vision of support for the creation of lead road safety agencies and the strengthening of existing ones; and (iii) the provision of guidance to improve road safety in road investments. The activities (which may be describe I as "components" of activities) to be financed by the Trust Fund are: 2.1 Bank-executed activities for which the Bank has implementation responsibility will consist of creating knowledge, carrying out issessments and case studies, providing technical advice and guidance as well as carrying out advocacies and dissemination in the three program pillars described above. 3
ï»¿2.2 Recipient executed activities for which the Recipient has implementation responsibility will consist of dissemination and applicatioi, at the Regional and national level of the knowledge created and disseminated by the program in tl e three program pillars described above. 3. Eligible Expenditures 3.1 For Bank-executed activities, the Trust Fund funds may be used to finance: (a) Associated Overheads (b) Consultant Fees Individua with Indirect Cost and Firms (c) Contractual Services (d) Equipment and Office Pre nises Lease Cost (e) Extended Term Consultan s with Indirect Costs (f) Field Assignment Benefits (g) Media, Workshop, Confer, nce and Meeting (h) Staff Costs with Indirect Costs (i) Temporary Support Staff Costs with Indirect Costs (j) Travel Expenses 3.2 For Recipient-executed activi ies, the Trust Fund funds may be used to finance eligible expenditures in accordance with the Bank's appliczble policies and procedures. 3.3 For Recipient-executed activi ies, the Trust Fund funds may be used to finance: (a) Consulting (b) Training (c) Other 4. Taxes 4.1 The foregoing activities an( categories of expenditures may include the financing of taxes in accordance with the Bank's applicabl policies and procedures. 5. Program Criteria 5.1 Activities are to be financed i i accordance with the following program criteria: A program of activities is associated to the results framework. Annual work programs will be developed in consultation with pillar working groups comprising representatives from stakeholders as defined in the operational manual. They will be app -oved by the SSATP Executive Committee and endorsed by the SSATP General Assembly. Program criteria f )r activities that provide country- or region- specific support are: - ownership: activities respon Ito a demand from countries or regional economic communities. - commitment: countries an d regional economic communities are committed to implement the outcome of the activity. - partnership: a partner has bcen identified to provide support during implementation, the last step in the policy development cycle which is outside the mandate if the SSATP. - sustainability: activities will be implemented until the results are achieved. 4
ï»¿6. Retroactive Financin2 6.1 The Trust Fund funds may bc used to retroactively finance payments for eligible expenditures made as of January 1, 2015 in accordance w ith the Bank's applicable policies and procedures. 5
ï»¿ANNEX2 Standard Provisions This Annex shall be applicable to an,I form an integral part of all Administration Agreements between the Bank and the respective Donors. 1. Administration of the Contributions 1.1 The Bank shall be responsitle only for performing those functions specifically set forth in this Administration Agreement and shall not be subject to any other duties or responsibilities to the Donors, including, without limitation, any duties or obligations that might otherwise apply to a fiduciary or trustee under general principles of trust or fiduciary law. Nothing in this Administration Agreement shall be considered a waiver of any privilege; or immunities of the Bank under its Articles of Agreement or any applicable law, all of which are expre5 sly reserved. 1.2 Each Donor's Contribution (< ollectively, the "Contributions") shall be administered in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures, as the same may be amended from time to time, including its procurement, financial nanagement, disbursement and safeguard policies, its framework to prevent and combat fraud and corrupti:)n and its screening procedures to prevent the use of Bank resources to finance terrorist activity, in line with the Bank's obligations to give effect to the relevant decisions of the Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the of Charter of the United Nations. The Donors acknowledge that this provision does not create any obligations of the Bank under the anti-terrorist financirg and asset control laws, regulations, rules and e ,ecutive orders of an individual member country that may apply to a Donor. 2. Management of the Contributions 2.1 The funds deposited in the Tr ist Fund shall be accounted for as a single trust fund and shall be kept separate and apart from the funds of Ihe Bank. The funds deposited in the Trust Fund may be commingled with other trust fund assets maintainec by the Bank. The Bank, in its capacity as trustee, has legal title to the funds deposited in the Trust Fund. 2.2 The currency in which the funds in the Trust Fund shall be held is United States Dollars (the "Holding Currency"). 2.3 Donors agree to deposit their Contributions in the Contribution Currency stated in their respective Administration Agreements. In the :ase of deposits received in a Contribution Currency other than the Holding Currency, promptly upon the receipt of such amounts and the accompanying Deposit Instructions, the Bank shall convert such amounts i ito the Holding Currency at the exchange rate obtained by the Bank on the date of the conversion. Where ceposits prove to be insufficient to complete activities as a result of exchange rate fluctuations, neither th, Bank nor the Donor shall bear any responsibility for providing any additional financing. 2.4 The funds deposited in the Trust Fund may be freely exchanged by the Bank into other currencies as may facilitate their disbursement at the exchange rate obtained by the Bank on the date of the conversion. 2.5 The Bank shall invest and reii vest the funds deposited in the Trust Fund pending their disbursement in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures for the investment of trust funds 6
ï»¿administered by the Bank. The Banl< shall credit all income from such investment to the Trust Fund to be used for the same purposes as the Con:ributions. 3. Trust Fund Fees and Costs 3.1 The Bank shall deduct and r tain for its own account, as a deduction from each Insiallment, an amount equal to two percent (2 %) pei Installment as an administrative fee for the Trust Fund. 3.2 In addition, costs incurred b3 the Bank for other expenses, such as for program management and Trust Fund administration, that are i) not covered by the percentage deduction specified above as an administrative fee and (ii) not include I under Annex I of the Administration Agreements in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures shall be charged to the Trust Fund on an actual basis up to a maximum of ten and seventeen peicent (10.17%) of the total Contributions under all Administration Agreements. 3.3 Each Donor acknowledges an I agrees that the percentage deductions for fees in this Trust Fund Fees and Costs section are estimated oii the basis of anticipated Contributions. If actual Contributions significantly differ from what was or ginally anticipated at the time of signature of the first Administration Agreement, or if other circumstances ffecting Trust Fund fees or costs change, the Bank reserves the right to request a change to the terms of this Trust Fund Fees and Costs section, which would be effectuated by amendments made to the Administrati on Agreements of all Donors and which would thereafter be applicable to all new Contributions that are pr )vided either as amendments to supplement existing Administration Agreements or from new Donors undc r new Administration Agreements. 4. Accounting and Financial R Porting 4.1 The Bank shall maintain sepai ate records and ledger accounts in respect of the funds deposited in the Trust Fund and disbursements made tl erefrom. 4.2 The Bank shall furnish to the )onors current financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the Holding Cu rency with respect to the Contributions via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. Within six (6) months after all commitments and liabilities under the Trust Fund have been satisfied and thi Trust Fund has been closed, the final financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund bala ice in the Holding Currency with respect to the Contributions shall be made available to the Donors via the 'World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. 4.3 The Bank shall provide to 1he Donors via the World Bank's Trust Fund Donor Center secure website, within six (6) months following the end of each Bank fiscal year, an annual single audit report, comprising (i) a management asserlion together with an attestation from the Bank's external auditors concerning the adequacy of internal control over cash-based financial reporting for all cash-based trust funds as a whole; and (ii) a combined finai cial statement for all cash-based trust funds together with the Bank's external auditor's opinion thereon. Ti e cost of the single audit shall be borne by the Bank. 4.4 If a Donor wishes to reques-, on an exceptional basis, a financial statement audit by the Bank's external auditors of the Trust Fund, th- Donor and the Bank shall first consult as to whether such an external audit is necessary. The Bank and the Donor shall agree on the appropriate scope and terms of reference of such audit. Following agreement on the scope and terms of reference, the Bank shall arrange for such external audit. The costs of any suc i audit, including the internal costs of the Bank with respect to such audit, shall be borne by the requesting Donor. 7
ï»¿4.5The Bank shall make available to the Donors copies of all financial statements and auditors' reports received by the Bank from Recipient; pursuant to any Grant Agreements (as defined below) in accordance with the Bank's Access to Informatior Policy. 5. Progress Reporting 5.1 The Bank shall provide the Donors with semi-annual reports on the progress of activities financed by the Contributions. Within six (6) mo iths of the End Disbursement Date (as defined below), the Bank shall furnish to the Donors a final report on the activities financed by the Trust Fund. 5.2 Any Donor may review or e) aluate activities financed by the Trust Fund at any time up to six (6) months following the End Disburseient Date. The Donor and the Bank shall agree on the scope and conduct of such review or evaluation, and the Bank shall provide all relevant information within the limits of the Bank's applicable policies and p-ocedures. All associated costs, including any costs incurred by the Bank, shall be borne by the Donor. I is understood that any such review or evaluation will not constitute a financial, compliance or other audit ol the Trust Fund. 6. Disbursement; Cancellation Refund 6.1 It is expected that the funds deposited in the Trust Fund will be fully disbursed by the Bank by December 31, 2018 (the "End Disbu -sement Date"). The Bank shall only disburse funds deposited in the Trust Fund for the purposes of this A Iministration Agreement (other than returns to Donors) after such date to the extent such date is changed in accordance with amendments made to the Administration Agreements of all the Donors. Following the End Disbursement Date, the Bank shall return any remaining balance of the Trust Fund to each Donor in the Holding Currency in the manner specified in its respective Administration Agreement on a pro rata basis with -egard to the total funds deposited in the Trust Fund by such Donor relative to the total funds deposited n the Trust Fund by all Donors, all calculated as Holding Currency amounts. 6.2 Any Donor may cancel all or )art of such Donor's pro rata share, and the Bank may cancel all or any Donors' pro rata shares, upon three (';) months' prior written notice, of any Contributions (paid and not yet paid) that are not committed pursuant to any agreements entered into between the Bank and any consultants and/or other third parties for the purposes of this Administration Agreement, including any Grant Agreements, prior to the receipt of st ch notice. In the event of a cancellation, the Bank shall return to the Donor its pro-rata share in the Holding Currency as specified in the Administration Agreement; unless otherwise agreed between the Bank at d the Donor. 7. Disclosure; Dispute Resolution 7.1 The Bank shall disclose the jdministration Agreements and related information on this Trust Fund in accordance with the Bank's P( licy on Access to Information. By entering into Administration Agreements, the Donors consent to siich disclosure of their respective Administration Agreements and such related information. 7.2 The Donors and the Bank sh;ll use their best efforts to amicably settle any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to the , dministration Agreements. 8
ï»¿8. Grants to Recipients 8.1 The Bank shall, as administre tor of the Trust Fund on behalf of the Donors, enter into one or more grant agreements (the "Grant Agreements") with recipients (the "Recipients") consistent with the purposes of this Administration Agreement and on the terms and conditions set forth in the Grant Agreements. Grant Agreements may be entered into up to the maximum amount of the Contributions that all Donors have agreed to make available under the Administi ation Agreements between the Bank and the Donors. 8.2 The Bank shall be responsi le for the supervision of the activities financed under any Grant Agreements. Subject to the consent o any relevant Recipients, representatives of the Donors may be invited by the Bank to participate in Bank sup orvision missions related to the Trust Fund. 8.3 The Bank shall promptly infoi m the Donors of any significant modification to the terms of any Grant Agreements and of any contractual remedies that are exercised by the Bank under any Grant Agreements. To the extent practicable, the Bank shall afford the Donors the opportunity to exchange views before effecting any such modification or ext rcising any such remedy. 9
ï»¿ANNEX 3 Governance This Annex shall be applicable to an I form an integral part of all Administration Agreements between the Bank and the respective Donors. The SSATP governance framework a!, defined in its Statutes comprises: 1. The General Assembly (GA) a consultative body that endorses SSATP DP3 mandate, development plans and the annual reports. 2. The Executive Committee (rc ferred to as the #Committee#), which is responsible for overseeing the implementation of the progrE m. It comprises representatives from the institutional administrator of SSATP (the World Bank), multi and bilateral, financing partners, African countries, African Institutions, Regional Econoriic Commissions (RECs), and the private sector. 3. An Independent Panel of Exp,-rts (IPEs) will advise the Committee on achieving program objectives. 4. The Secretariat of the Committee is the Program Management Team (PMT) that provides both advisory and day-to-day ma -agement support to the Committee; and also responsible for Third Development Plan (DP3) res0lts management. 5. Working Groups (WG) fror member countries will support the PMT and will be responsible for developing country-specific work program and will be involved at all stages of product development. 10
